DOC.brief_summary: This study test whether smoke cessation intervention pregnant woman extend postpartum ( Striving Quit ( STQ ) ) implement disseminated outside research environment establish effectiveness ( 40 % maintain biochemically verify 6-month abstinence ) . The research aim : Is Striving Quit effective achieve postpartum smoking cessation `` First Breath , '' current standard care pregnant woman Wisconsin smoke ? 250 woman randomize one two study group . Pregnant woman Group A ( n=125 ) receive exist First Breath prenatal intervention . Those Group B ( Striving Quit ( STQ ) , n=125 ) receive Group A intervention , plus 1 additional prenatal home visit , 3 postpartum in-home smoking cessation counsel visit , 3 postpartum phone call , additional $ 100 gift card . The primary outcome biochemically confirm smoke cessation 6-months postpartum .
DOC.brief_title: Disseminating Implementing Smoking Cessation Program Pregnant Postpartum Women
DOC.criteria: Pregnant ; enrol First Breath ; Resides Wisconsin county Calumet , Fond Du Lac , Kewaunee , Menominee , Oconto , Shawno , Sheyboygan , Winnebago , Door , Brown , Outagamie , Manitowac , Waupaca ; English speaking ; willingness quit reduce smoke next 30 day already quit , desire remain quit delivery ; daily smoking ( least 1 cigarette/day least 1 week past 6 month ; willing provide update contact information pregnant ; smoke past 6 month ; involve another smoking research study .
